SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
LevelParent.Listener, MenuScreen.Listener
public class Controller extends Object implements LevelParent.Listener, MenuScreen.Listener
controls the entire flow of the game, changing the scene between levels and menus, instantiates all levels and menus

  • Method Details

    • launchGame

      public void launchGame() throws SecurityException, IllegalArgumentException
      shows the stage and displays the first scene: the main menu
      Throws:
      SecurityException
      IllegalArgumentException

    • goToLevel

      private void goToLevel(String className, int health) throws ClassNotFoundException, NoSuchMethodException, SecurityException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, IllegalArgumentException, InvocationTargetException
      the call to instantiate a new level, takes data that is the class name, calls its constructor and passes appropriate values (health). sets the scene and begins the level.
      Parameters:
      className - name of the class of the level for its constructor to be called in the function.
      health - value for the player health, carries over between levels.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException
      NoSuchMethodException
      SecurityException
      InstantiationException
      IllegalAccessException
      IllegalArgumentException
      InvocationTargetException

    • fetch

      public void fetch(String data, int health)
      called by listened classes StartMenu.java and LevelParent.java. passes the next level name from those classes.
      Specified by:
      fetch in interface LevelParent.Listener
      Specified by:
      fetch in interface MenuScreen.Listener
      Parameters:
      data - name of the class of the level for its constructor to be called in the function.
      health - value for the player health, carries over between levels.

    • gameEnded

      public void gameEnded(boolean n)
      called LevelParent.java to set the scene to a win or lose menu screen. passes a boolean to decide which screen to display.
      Specified by:
      gameEnded in interface LevelParent.Listener
      Parameters:
      n - boolean determining whether the menu should display a win or loss screen.
